body_html: @zheng-xq: Any thoughts? @alexlee-gk: If not, we may have to close this as expected behavior, unfortunately. It sounds like your 97.7% vs. 9.8% difference occurs for a model where different CPU systems can also produce 10%, and thus that you may have found an impressively unreliable set of hyperparameters. If using a smaller learning rate helps, it may just mean that the GPU version blows up slightly earlier than the CPU version.

body: @zheng-xq: Any thoughts?  @alexlee-gk: If not, we may have to close this as expected behavior, unfortunately.  It sounds like your 97.7% vs. 9.8% difference occurs for a model where different CPU systems can also produce 10%, and thus that you may have found an impressively unreliable set of hyperparameters.  If using a smaller learning rate helps, it may just mean that the GPU version blows up slightly earlier than the CPU version.
